dict.string: Forest Gump
Life is like a box of chocolates.
Myhkail Mendoza
You've got to pay the price, if you want to look nice.
Ariana Grande
I only want to die alive, never by the hands of a broken heart.
Richard Stallman
With paper printed books, you have certain freedoms. You can acquire the book anonymously by paying cash, which is the way I always buy books. I never use a credit card.
Bill Gates
It's fine to celebrate success but it is more important to heed the lessons of failure.
Omar N. Bradley
Bravery is the capacity to perform properly even when scared half to death.
John Wayne
Courage is being scared to death and saddling up anyway.
Angela Davis
We have to talk about liberating minds as well as liberating society.
Dwight D. Eisenhower
A people that values its privileges above its principles soon loses both.
E. B. White
Genius is more often found in a cracked pot than in a whole one.
Woodrow Wilson
I not only use all the brains that I have, but all that I can borrow.
Salvador Dali
Intelligence without ambition is a bird without wings.
Ann Landers
People who drink to drown their sorrow should be told that sorrow knows how to swim.
Confucius
We should feel sorrow, but not sink under its oppression.
William Shakespeare
When sorrows come, they come not single spies, but in battalions.
Peter Drucker
The most important thing in communication is hearing what isn't said.
Dr. Seuss
A person's a person, no matter how small.
Leonardo da Vinci
While I thought that I was learning how to live, I have been learning how to die.
Steve Jobs
Things don't have to change the world to be important.
George Bernard Shaw
We are made wise not by the recollection of our past, but by the responsibility for our future.
Robert Frost
Forgive me my nonsense, as I also forgive the nonsense of those that think they talk sense.
Marcus Tullius Cicero
The higher we are placed, the more humbly we should walk.
Rabindranath Tagore
Everything comes to us that belongs to us if we create the capacity to receive it.
Judy Garland
Always be a first-rate version of yourself, instead of a second-rate version of somebody else.
Confucius
The strength of a nation derives from the integrity of the home.
Bernard Williams
There is no psychiatrist in the world like a puppy licking your face.
George Orwell
Freedom is the right to tell people what they do not want to hear.
George Washington
If the freedom of speech is taken away then dumb and silent we may be led, like sheep to the slaughter.
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
Age merely shows what children we remain.
Lin Yutang
No one realizes how beautiful it is to travel until he comes home and rests his head on his old, familiar pillow.
Mahatma Gandhi
Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.
Saint Augustine
The world is a book, and those who do not travel read only a page.
Lewis B. Smedes
It takes one person to forgive, it takes two people to be reunited.
Eric Sevareid
Better to trust the man who is frequently in error than the one who is never in doubt.
Albert Einstein
Whoever is careless with the truth in small matters cannot be trusted with important matters.
William Arthur Ward
Feeling gratitude and not expressing it is like wrapping a present and not giving it.
Gloria Estefan
The sad truth is that opportunity doesn't knock twice.
Franz Schubert
Nobody understands another's sorrow, and nobody another's joy.
Leo Buscaglia
Worry never robs tomorrow of its sorrow, it only saps today of its joy.
Bill Maher
Suicide is man's way of telling God, 'You can't fire me - I quit.'
Emil Zatopek
A runner must run with dreams in his heart, not money in his pocket.
Ludwig Wittgenstein
The human body is the best picture of the human soul.
George Canning
Indecision and delays are the parents of failure.
Paul Sweeney
True success is overcoming the fear of being unsuccessful.
Stevie Wonder
Ability may get you to the top, but it takes character to keep you there.
Stevie Wonder
Just because a man lacks the use of his eyes doesn't mean he lacks vision.
Charles R. Swindoll
Each day of our lives we make deposits in the memory banks of our children.
Frederick Douglass
It is easier to build strong children than to repair broken men.
Bruce Lee
Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them.
Ronald Reagan
All great change in America begins at the dinner table.
Andy Warhol
They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.
Wayne Dyer
If you change the way you look at things, the things you look at change.
Mahatma Gandhi
You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
Rabindranath Tagore
By plucking her petals, you do not gather the beauty of the flower.
Pablo Neruda
You can cut all the flowers but you cannot keep spring from coming.
Greek Proverb
A society grows great when old men plant trees whose shade they know they shall never sit in.
John Major
Recovery begins from the darkest moment.
Auguste Rodin
Nothing is a waste of time if you use the experience wisely.
John W. Gardner
Life is the art of drawing without an eraser.
Immanuel Kant
Experience without theory is blind, but theory without experience is mere intellectual play.
Benjamin Franklin
A house is not a home unless it contains food and fire for the mind as well as the body.
Charles Dickens
Charity begins at home, and justice begins next door.
Ernest Hemingway
We are all broken, that’s how the light gets in.
Neil Degrasse Tyson
When Students cheat on exams it's because our School System values grades more than Students value learning.
George Burns
You can't help getting older, but you don't have to get old.
Stanislaw Jerzy Lec
Youth is the gift of nature, but age is a work of art.
Jean-Paul Sartre
If you are lonely when you're alone, you are in bad company.
George S. Patton
If you tell people where to go, but not how to get there, you'll be amazed at the results.
Noam Chomsky
If there was an observer on Mars, they would probably be amazed that we have survived this long.
Tom Ford
When the youth of America gets together, amazing things happen.
Ralph Waldo Emerson
For every minute you remain angry, you give up sixty seconds of peace of mind.
Bob Marley
If you get down and quarrel everyday, you're saying prayers to the devil, I say.
Plato
There are two things a person should never be angry at, what they can help, and what they cannot.
Joseph Joubert
The best remedy for a short temper is a long walk.
Jim Rohn
Whatever good things we build end up building us.
Louis Sullivan
Form follows function.
Henry David Thoreau
This world is but a canvas to our imagination.
Michelangelo
The true work of art is but a shadow of the divine perfection.
John C. Maxwell
People may hear your words, but they feel your attitude.
Hans Selye
Adopting the right attitude can convert a negative stress into a positive one.
Francis Bacon
The best part of beauty is that which no picture can express.
Priscilla Presley
Inner beauty should be the most important part of improving one's self.
Anne Frank
I don't think of all the misery but of the beauty that still remains.
David Hume
Beauty in things exists in the mind which contemplates them.
Steve Prefontaine
To give anything less than your best, is to sacrifice the gift.
Aldous Huxley
Beauty is worse than wine, it intoxicates both the holder and beholder.
Eli Khamarov
The best things in life are unexpected - because there were no expectations.
Eddie Vedder
The best revenge is to live on and prove yourself.
Carl Jung
Knowing your own darkness is the best method for dealing with the darknesses of other people.
William Barclay
There are two great days in a person's life - the day we are born and the day we discover why.
George Meredith
Don't just count your years, make your years count.
George Harrison
All the world is birthday cake, so take a piece, but not too much.
Winston Churchill
We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give.
Carl Sagan
Somewhere, something incredible is waiting to be known.
M. C. Escher
We adore chaos because we love to produce order.
Thomas Browne
Rough diamonds may sometimes be mistaken for worthless pebbles.
Mark Twain
Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect.
Henry Ford
A business that makes nothing but money is a poor business.
Thomas A. Edison
Just because something doesn't do what you planned it to do doesn't mean it's useless.
IMPORTANT!! THIS ENTRY MUST BE LAST
This quote will not show. Serves as a filler for our shuffle code. MAKE SURE THIS IS THE LAST ENTRY
